employee_external_id.notes: Direct mapping - employee identifier in both systems. Personio uses integer type.

absence_type_external_id.notes: Direct mapping - time-off type identifier in both systems. Personio uses integer type.

start_date.notes: Direct mapping - both use YYYY-MM-DD string format for absence start date.

end_date.notes: Direct mapping - both use YYYY-MM-DD string format for absence end date.

start_half_day.notes: Direct mapping - both use boolean to indicate if absence starts at half-day.

end_half_day.notes: Direct mapping - both use boolean to indicate if absence ends at half-day.

employee_note.notes: Direct mapping - optional comment/note field in both systems.

status.reason: Personio CreateTimeOffPeriodRequest does not include status field. Status appears to be handled differently in Personio workflow.
status.ground_truth_path: N/A - Field not present in CreateTimeOffPeriodRequest schema
status.notes: Personio likely handles approval workflow separately from creation request. May need to query existing time-off periods for status information.

amount.reason: Personio CreateTimeOffPeriodRequest does not include amount field. Duration calculated from start_date to end_date.
amount.ground_truth_path: N/A - Field not present in CreateTimeOffPeriodRequest schema
amount.notes: Personio calculates duration automatically from start and end dates. If amount is needed, it must be calculated from date difference.

unit.reason: Personio CreateTimeOffPeriodRequest does not include unit field. Always works with full days.
unit.ground_truth_path: N/A - Field not present in CreateTimeOffPeriodRequest schema
unit.notes: Personio time-off system works in full days, no unit specification needed. Half-days handled via half_day_start/half_day_end flags.

processing_context: Personio API time-off management - primary endpoint POST /company/time-offs with CreateTimeOffPeriodRequest schema
